item.title: India's women wrestlers defy traditional roles
item.description: The success of India's female wresters - at home and abroad - has inspired more young women in the country to take up the sport. @DW
item.keywords: DWVC,India, women, wrestling, sports, female athletes, inspiration, gender equality, empowerment, cultural change, athletic achievement, Phogat sisters

media:content.media:title: India's women wrestlers defy traditional roles

item.title: Rape used as a weapon in the Tigray conflict
item.description: The war in northern Ethiopia ranks among the deadliest conflicts in recent times. UN investigators say rape was also used as a weapon of war. With a ceasefire agreed, more and more stories of atrocities are emerging. @DW
item.keywords: DWVC,war, Ethiopia, Tigray, conflict, violence, UN investigation, rape, ceasefire, atrocities, human rights

media:content.media:title: Rape used as a weapon in the Tigray conflict
media:content.media:keywords: DWVC,war, Ethiopia, Tigray, conflict, violence, UN investigation, rape, ceasefire, atrocities, human rights

item.title: Is Snapchat helping predators?
item.description: Snapchat integrated ChatGPT and created the AI-chatbot "My AI". When a tech entrepreneur registered as a 13-year-old girl, the chatbot supported her plan to go on vacation with a 31-year-old man she just met. But why?
item.keywords: DWVC,Snapchat, ChatGPT, AI, chatbot, tech entrepreneurship, online safety, child protection, social media, privacy concerns, ethical considerations

media:content.media:title: Is Snapchat helping predators?
media:content.media:keywords: DWVC,Snapchat, ChatGPT, AI, chatbot, tech entrepreneurship, online safety, child protection, social media, privacy concerns, ethical considerations

item.title: Begging for a living in Istanbul
item.description: Ali Marmara came to Istanbul as a teenager because he had problems at home. He tells us what itâ€™s like to live on the streets, begging for a living â€“ and how hard it is to escape the poverty trap.

item.title: Delivery of heavy weapons: Is Germany now a party to the war in Ukraine?
item.description: Germanyâ€™s decision to deliver tanks to Ukraine drew criticism from Russia and speculation about whether this step could make Germany a party to the conflict. In international law, there is a simple answer to that question.

item.title: Woman in Tigray lost husband and son to violence
item.description: This woman in Tigray lost both her husband and son to a massacre. Almost 600,000 lives have been lost in the conflict, before Ethiopian and Tigrayan forces signed a peace deal in November 2022. @DW

media:content.media:title: Woman in Tigray lost husband and son to violence

item.title: Deadly asbestos in Indonesia
item.description: Asbestos is cheap and heat-resistant. It was used widely in building materials all around the world. Today, it is banned in over 70 countries, including all EU member states. But the carcinogenic material is still widely used in developing countries.
item.keywords: DWVC,Indonesia, Asbestos, EU ban, developing countries

media:content.media:title: Deadly asbestos in Indonesia
media:content.media:keywords: DWVC,Indonesia, Asbestos, EU ban, developing countries

item.title: Extensive reconstruction of Bucha in motion
item.description: Bucha, made famous around the world for the atrocities Russian troops carried out there. The main road was strewn with bodies when the Russians leftâ€¯- and the houses were also partially destroyed by artillery. Now work is underway to repair the houses and turn Bucha back into a livable community.
item.keywords: DWVC,Ukraine, Bucha, Russia, war, reconstruction, housing

media:content.media:title: Extensive reconstruction of Bucha in motion
media:content.media:keywords: DWVC,Ukraine, Bucha, Russia, war, reconstruction, housing

item.title: Jehovah's Witness hall shooting in Hamburg
item.description: Police officials said the perpetrator and the victims were all German citizens. The gunman killed himself, and an unborn baby as well as seven others were pronounced dead.

media:content.media:title: Jehovah's Witness hall shooting in Hamburg
